description: The Father of the House admitted injuring the officer, who was cycling in Westminster at the time.
title: MP Sir Edward Leigh fined for opening car door on police officer
title_page: MP Sir Edward Leigh fined for opening car door on police officer - BBC News
maintext:
An MP has been fined for injuring a police officer by opening his car door.
Sir Edward Leigh, the Conservative MP for Gainsborough, Lincolnshire, pleaded guilty to a charge of opening a vehicle door so as to injure or endanger a person.
The officer was riding a bike at the time of the incident in Horseferry Road, Westminster, on 6 August last year.
Sir Edward, 74, who is the Father of the House, was ordered to pay a fine of Â£120 by Bromley Magistrates' Court.
